185920863.review: Horror classic fondly remembered, and for a good reason. The perfect blend of combat and atmosphere. 185793524.review:
Just tried to play that game in January 2025, here's my experience:

Start the game, first cinematic, camera spinning around like crazy. The solution if you don't care about not using a controller: create a joypad.txt file within the folder \Documents\Electronic Arts\Dead Space , it will disable the gamepad (and NO, unplugging and plugging it back does not fix it).
Restart the game, cannot skip cinematic.
Start actually playing. SECOND DOOR of the game: invisible wall. Apparently this can be fixed by going into your graphics card control pannel and forcing Triple Buffering into Dead Space.exe 
Restart the game, cannot skip cinematic.
Reach the end of first cinematic: game crash.
F' that.

185657302.review:
Muy buen juego. Una vez te acostumbras al ambiente y tal, vas a tiro hecho y la parte de "pavor" se pierde, y los bichos terminan siendo un poco repetitivos, aunque en si hay variedad claramente, pero no son algo que realmente digas "wao, da respeto", prácticamente son el mismo bicho pero algo más rápido, sin piernas, más gordo, y así.

Su optimización mejorable. No uséis v.sync in game, os va a realentizar muchísimo el juego. Tiene un delay curioso, aunque te puedes acostumbrar, y en mando la "dead zone" de los joysticks es brutal. Se puede jugar bien, pero movimientos pequeños más precisos son muy difíciles de hacer.

Le doy un 7 en general. Me recuerda mucho a resident evil 4 (más o menos de la misma época), pero este último es en general, un poco mejor.

185161240.review:
Dead Space is a masterpiece of survival horror, setting a gold standard for the genre and leaving an indelible mark on gaming history. 
This spine-chilling title expertly combines atmospheric storytelling, innovative gameplay, and nerve-wracking tension to deliver an unforgettable experience!
The storytelling is masterfully subtle, unfolding through audio logs, environmental details, and Isaac’s growing desperation. 
Gameplay is where Dead Space truly shines... 
The innovative "strategic dismemberment" mechanic forces you to rethink traditional shooter tactics. 
Simply aiming for the head won’t cut it here; you need to sever limbs and incapacitate enemies in creative ways, which adds a layer of strategic depth to every encounter. 
The weaponry, especially the iconic Plasma Cutter, feels satisfying and perfectly suited for the grim task at hand.
The immersive presentation elevates Dead Space to another level. 
The HUD, integrated seamlessly into Isaac’s suit, is a stroke of genius that enhances immersion and keeps you grounded in the game world. 
The haunting sound design deserves special praise, with eerie whispers, distant clanging, and the Necromorphs' guttural screeches creating an atmosphere of constant dread. 
The visuals, even today, hold up remarkably well, with the Ishimura’s dark, oppressive corridors dripping with detail and oozing with atmosphere.
Dead Space is relentless in its ability to unsettle... 
The pacing is immaculate, alternating between moments of high-intensity action and quieter, more psychological horror. 
The jump scares are earned and effective, complemented by an overarching sense of dread that keeps you on edge throughout the game.
Isaac Clarke himself, initially a silent protagonist, becomes a relatable and compelling figure as the game progresses. 
His vulnerability, coupled with the weight of his personal struggles, adds an emotional layer to the horror, making his journey all the more gripping.
Dead Space is not just a game, it’s an experience! 
Its ability to terrify and captivate in equal measure ensures its place among the all-time greats of the horror genre. 
If you’re a fan of survival horror and haven’t ventured into the Ishimura yet, you’re missing out on a seminal experience! 
Dead Space is a must-play, and its legacy as one of the finest horror games ever made remains unshaken.

184643323.review:
You should do these two things before playing the game on PC with mouse and keyboard:
1) Don't use the game's vsync feature and use vsync via your graphics driver. The game's own vsync caps the fps to 30 and makes it very unpleasant.
2) Download the Dead Space mouse fix fan patch. The mouse aiming is normally dreadfully bad and this patch makes it perfect.

Those two easily fixable issues aside, this game is so fantastic. I'm not all that familiar with horror games, and I don't think this game is scary in the slightest, but every other aspect of it is top notch.

First, the gameplay. It's absolutely perfect. You have to shoot the Necromorphs' limbs to kill them, then stomp on them to make sure they are dead. The shooting is impactful, satisfying, requires precision and the gore is really good too. There's a lot of weapons that can be bought from the store, though I only used the Plasma Cutter and the Pulse Rifle, both of which were enough.

You have some tools like Stasis and Kinesis, though they are used more often for puzzles than combat. Stasis is used to slow down fast object/enemies, and Kinesis allows you to move objects and throw smaller ones at enemies. These tools make the puzzle sections fun, and though I didn't use them much in combat they were useful in that regard too.

There's a lot of Necromorph types with distinct behaviors. Slashers are the most common ones and are easy to kill, Swarmers constantly leap at you and can be annoying to deal with, Pregnants spawn more enemies if you shoot their belly, and the Exploders might be my favourite type of Necromorph. You can shoot down the explosive they carry to kill them and other enemies around them, and the explosion is glorious. Every now and then there's also the Brute, a miniboss that is very dangerous and makes you want to use Stasis on it to make it more easily manageable.

The presentation of the game is really good too. The graphics on a basic standpoint look good, and the ship has a lot of dark areas and areas filled with fleshy walls that are kinda gross. The most interesting part of the game is the HUD. Instead of it being a typical HUD, it's very different. The player's health and stasis are shown on the back of the suit, video screens are shown in front of Isaac and move with him as he moves etc. It's very innovative.

There's the Zero-Gravity areas which are creative, with you being able to jump from one distant location to another, and enemies like Leapers attack from every direction in those areas. I find them to be some of the most fun parts of the game.

Levels also have parts where you are outside the ship and need oxygen to survive, which gives a sense of tension. Enemies often appear and you want to kill them quickly so you can leave the areas before your oxygen becomes dangerously low. Isaac's exhausted breathing and a lot of things being quiet makes it quite tense.

Enemies and ammo crates give you resources you need, like ammo and weapons, and you can also buy said resources from the shop. There's items that have the sole purpose of giving you more money when you sell them, making you want to look for them. The most important things to buy in the shop are suit upgrades and power nodes. Suit upgrades allow you to carry much more resources, and you can use power nodes for things like increasing your health, making weapons deal more damage and take less time to reload etc. Power nodes also appear in many locations, so it's good to look for them.

The story is... alright. Isaac tries to find his girlfriend over the course of the game, and the other few survivors like Hammond help him. I didn't find any of the characters all that interesting, and Isaac has Gordon Freeman personality. The twist at the end of the game was cool though, and the ending... had something sudden happen out of nowhere.

Boss fights are fun, but they are on the easier side. All of the bosses require you to shoot at yellow parts of their bodies to kill dismember them, and they all can be killed without much trouble. I'd say the hardest boss was the Slug, and that was mainly due to the bad turret controls.

As I said, I find the game to be very lacking in the horror department. It's atmospheric, but not really scary. The game sometimes uses jumpscares that aren't even shocking, and I also didn't find the violent death scenes to be that disturbing.

[h1] Conclusion [/h1]
Dead Space 1 might be one of the best games I have played in a long time. Lackluster horror and kinda bad story aside, the game is amazing in every aspect. Combat is great, graphics are great and level design is great. The game is outright a masterpiece in my eyes and I recommend it.

[h1] 9.5/10 [/h1]

184494528.review:
Um dos grandes nomes do survival-horror. 

Para um fã de Resident Evil como eu, foi muito fascinante jogar Dead Space. Captura perfeitamente a essência de Survival horror, levando-a à um novo patamar ao atrelar monstros bizarros, horror e conceitos do espaço. 

Positivos:
-A ambientação é soberba, especialmente na primeira metade do jogo
-O mundo é mortal, e não esquece elementos clássicos do Sci-fi atrelados à exploração espacial. Há zonas com gravidade zero e zonas de vácuo, onde a gameplay muda significativamente. 
-A progressão do personagem em termos de armas, vida, e equipamento é cativante
-Apesar de ter mais de 15 anos, o jogo tem uma jogabilidade muito boa e agradável

Negativos:
-Apesar da história ser boa e interessante, a conclusão deixa um pouco a desejar e acabou minando um pouco a profundidade do que foi previamente apresentado. Pelo menos ao meu ver.
-Sendo bem crítico, o jogo poderia se beneficiar de uma variedade maior de inimigos. Talvez isso faria com que  a gameplay não parecesse ter um pouco de gordura lá para o meio da história.  

Recomendo o jogo, e acredito ser uma aventura que não falha em entregar aquilo que promete e surpreender ao fazê-lo.

184487939.review: Um dos últimos jogos que zerei em 2024, e foi pela primeira vez. Comecei no 2, fui pro 3, e depois, finalmente fechei a trilogia. Jogão, mesmo sendo experiente em jogos de terror e sabendo o que esperar de Dead Space, esse daqui me deu uns cagaços em vários momentos. Melhor que os atuais "jogos modernos" para "audiências modernas".

184456703.review:
Dead Space- это культовый survival horror, который бросает вызов вашему хладнокровию и навыкам выживания. Эта мрачная, напряженная и атмосферная игра перенесет вас на космический корабль USG ishimura, захваченный ужасными некроморфами.
Dead Space идеально подойдет любителям хорроров, научной фантастики и напряженного геймплея. Если вы фанат таких игр, как:Resedent Evil или Alien:isolation, то Dead Space точно для вас.
Оригинальная игра 2008 года стала культовой, а ремейк 2023 года улучшил графику, анимацию и управление, сохранив все, за что эту игру полюбили.
Готовы ли вы выжить на USG Ishimura?

184318728.review:
An iconic classic still fun today, 7.5/10 at its worst.

This is a critical review looking back at a game from 2008 and how it plays today on PC. The weapon balancing seemed off, I ditched the plasma cutter early on which clearly was never thought about. My game became soft locked as the ripper couldn't kill the tentacle drag pull or the leviathan so had to run back to buy the contact beam (note this is on impossible but max upgrades). 

Odd design decisions that left me scratching my head. Had a node locked door not returnable but no store or node pickups in that section. I used stasis on a moving object that kills you instantly for it to have no effect (turns out you have to go out into space to complete the objective) just short sighted stuff. 

I liked the forgiving checkpoint system as it made death not painful and pushed the player to inch further ahead, you could always give it another try. As the game is dated, the keybind options for me were poor. A known issue where I had to enable vsync and lower my frames to get through one door at the beginning. Also I fell through the map at one point when using a lift, so the game does lack some polish. 

Honestly there is so much to love in this game including your death animations. It hasn't aged the best but is playable provided some tweaks here and there and a little patience. When it works it works great and you can quickly forget that this game came out in 2008. This game does a lot right just age catching up to it.

184103120.review:
Dead Space może i nie jest tytułem rewolucyjnym, ale z pewnością jest to jeden z najlepszych reprezentantów gatunku survival horror. Bierze wiele rzeczy Resident Evil 4 dodając też sporo własnych elementów, które czynią ten tytuł całkiem oryginalnym, na czele z sci-fi settingiem i wszystkim co z nim związane, a także wyjątkową mechaniką zadawania dodatkowych obrażeń wrogom poprzez odstrzeliwywanie ich kończyn. Grę ukończyłem w około kilkanaście godzin, świetnie się przy tym bawiąc. Mogę śmiało polecić ten tytuł każdemu, kto szuka dobrego survival horroru, w szczególności takiego osadzonego w kosmosie, a także fanom Resident Evil 4, szczególnie jeśli narzekali że RE4 nie ma wystarczająco strasznych elementów. Dead Space przechodziłem na poziomie trudności Hard i jeśli ktoś szuka wyzwania, tzn. rzeczywistego SURVIVAL horroru, który wymaga oszczędzania amunicji, to jest to idealny wybór na pierwsze przejście (ostrzegam tylko, że na początku może być na prawdę ciężko).

EDIT: Czy opłaca się zagrać w tą wersję zamiast w remake z 2023r.? Napiszę na pewno o tym jak już przejdę remake. Na ten moment mogę jednak śmiało powiedzieć, że DS z 2008r. zestarzał się bardzo dobrze i nie licząc drobnego problemu z ustawieniem limitu fps-ów jest w pełni grywalny.

+ Interesująca fabuła, nawet jeśli główny plot twist widać z kilometra

+ Klimatyczne i miejscami bardzo ładne lokacje

+ Bardzo fajne sekwencje bez grawitacji w których to możemy skakać od powierzchni od powierzchni i chodzić po ścianach czy nawet po suficie. Przeciwnicy też mogą to robić, co wprowadza dodatkową warstwę mechanik do systemu walki

+ Świetny design przeciwników oraz wystarczająca ich różnorodność

+ Bardzo ciekawy pomysł na zadawanie krytycznych obrażeń wrogom, poprzez strzelanie w ich kończyny, a nie w głowy. Strzelanie w kończyny może tez je uciąć co znacząco osłabi wroga, np. poprzez odstrzelenie nogi możemy zmusić stwora do czołgania się co znacząco go spowolni

+ Świetnie wyglądające efekty rozczłonkowywania oraz duża doza brutalności

+ Ciekawe mechaniki tymczasowego spowolnienia przedmiotów i przeciwników, a także przyciągania do nas przedmiotów i nimi rzucania. Obu opcji musimy używać w zagadkach, a spowolnienia (wprowadzenia w stazę) możemy też użyć na przeciwnikach

+ Nie ma ich dużo, ale walki z bossami są bardzo dobrze zrobione

+ Podobny do tego z RE4 sklep oraz system waluty znajdywanej w otoczeniu i wypadającej z wrogów

+ Miejscami bywa całkiem strasznie

+ Genialne udźwiękowienie sygnalizujące o obecności wrogów

+ Mimo paru gorszych tekstur, oprawa graficzna cieszy oko nawet po 16 latach od premiery - niektóre widoczki powodują opad szczeny

+ Interfejs gry zapewnia świetną immersję - wszelkie ekrany jak sklep, ekwipunek czy mapa są projekcjami generowanymi przed hełmem naszego protagonisty, a ich otwarcie nie wstrzymuje gry. Dodatkowo, zamiast celownika na ekranie mamy wskaźnik laserowy, a ilość amunicji w magazynku wyświetla się na małym ekranie na naszej broni

- V-sync nie ogranicza FPS-ów do 60, a do 30, z kolei przy zbyt dużej liczbie FPS-ów fizyka gry się kompletnie psuje i mamy ogromne problemy z poruszaniem się, a wszelkie ciała glitchują się i robią różne śmieszne rzeczy. Aby rozwiązać oba te problemy należy wyłączyć V-sync w opcjach gry, a następnie w Nvidia Control Panel (lub odpowiedniku dla użytkowników AMD), w ustawieniach 3d włączyć V-sync dla DeadSpace.exe

- Brak polskiej wersji, aczkolwiek można bez problemu pobrać spolszczenie (polskie napisy)

184048319.review:
I'm kind of disappointed with Dead Space, honestly. Now, it is not a bad game, first and foremost, it's just I went in with high expectations, and it simply did not quite fulfill them. I thought "The political intrigue and character motivations of Ridley Scott's 'Alien', coupled with the psychological and body horror of John Carpenter's 'The Thing'? This must be one of the best horror games ever!" How naive of me.

Body horror has never quite been my cup of tea. I do not directly associate blood and gore with fear or even 'unsettling-ness'. To me, the more viscera you pump into your game does not make it scarier, it only makes it a bit more gross, and over doing it makes graphic deaths lack impact as the audience grows accustomed to the gore.

Jumpscares are a topic I touch on with every horror game and movie I play or watch. They rarely startle me passed the first few, and even when they do, the instant shock passes very quickly, not leaving any lasting impression.

The story is forgetful, and shallow. I cannot remember a single character's name beyond Isaac and Nicole, nor can I recall major plot points. Characters, regardless of their importance to the story, drop like flies, as such it felt useless to become attached to any in any way.

The core story-gameplay loop got tiresome. "Isaac, this part needs fixing!" You go to fix it, fighting monsters along the way. "Good work Isaac! Ah, damn it, now this other thing needs fixing, go fix it!" Rinse and repeat for 12 chapters, some reusing the same levels you already cleared once before.

If I were to give my own two cents: Watch Alien and The Thing instead. They tell better stories in shorter  time frames with great pacing and memorable characters. Now, if you enjoyed both and desire more, then Dead Space is an ok place to continue.

I give Dead Space (2008):

7 Power Nodes out of 10

The more I play and watch horror content, the more I realize maybe the genre simply isn't for me. I find most shallow, and not very scary at all, really. This game might've gotten me with a jumpscare once in the entire 8 hours of playtime.

P.S. - Jumpscares are loud, like REALLY loud. Do your ears a favor, and play at lower volume, lest you be ear-graped (minus the g)

The definitive SCI-FI horror experience.

184023114.review: great game decent story line gun play is fairly basic the 3rd person view at the time was definitely interesting but for 2008 this game is pretty solid

184009330.review:
Dead Space es un juegazo de terror y ciencia ficción que te tiene al borde del asiento de principio a fin. La ambientación, los gráficos y el diseño de sonido están tan bien hechos que te sumergen de lleno en la oscura atmósfera del USG Ishimura, ese desastroso barco minero en el que tenés que sobrevivir a la invasión de necromorfos. Te la pasás cortando monstruos con la cortadora de plasma, y la verdad, es una experiencia de miedo bárbara.

Ahora, hablando de lo no tan bonito, está ese bug con los FPS  y el mouse que le da dolor de cabeza a más de uno, pero se soluciona facil con el Rivatuner.

En resumen, Dead Space es un must para los fans del survival horror. A pesar de ese bug, la experiencia general es tan atrapante que vale la pena arreglarlo y seguir adelante con la historia de Isaac Clarke. ¡No te lo pierdas! 🎮🛠️

183917570.review: Um clássico, não joguei na época do lançamento, foi mais um que entrou na minha lista de games atrasados que não pude jogar kkk, estava com ele há anos na minha biblioteca, mas por falta de tempo só agora em 2024 resolvi jogar, e meus amigos(as), que jogo incrível. Se você gosta de jogos singleplayer, uma história linear bem bacana e jogos de terror, pode comprar que não irá se arrepender. Esse é do tempo que a EA sabia fazer jogos bons. Dead Space da de 10x0 em muitos games AAA de hoje em dia, um jogo de 2008 que é muito bem feito, envelheceu muito bem e se o seu PC é fraco é não roda o remaster, pode compra esse que ainda vale muito a pena. Dead Space é um dos melhores jogos que já joguei e é um dos melhores games já feitos.

183695422.review: Uno de los mejores survival horrors que he jugado

183686148.review:
O primeiro Dead Space hoje em dia já e um clássico dos jogos de terror, perdi as contas de vezes que zerei na era X360 e alem de ser um dos meu jogos de terror favoritos.
Hoje em dia tem uns gráficos ainda decentes visto que ele tem mais de 10 anos desde quando lançando, com uma game play semelhante a Resident Evil 4 porem com uma imersão muito maior pelo falto do HUD do jogo esta presente em tempo real dando um realismo bem diferente de jogos com a mesma pegada.
A historia para quem nunca jogou ainda tem seu charme e seu Plot Twister bem colocado, sendo uma mistura de ficção científica com horror Lovercraftiano um jogo praticamente obrigatório para quem e fã de jogos de terror.

183639470.review: One of the best games ever made, it's really an incredible experience from start to finish!
